column1: '''Arise, arise, Riders of Théoden!''' is a rallying cry spoken by [[Théoden]] to the [[Riders of Rohan]]. Variations of it appear when he is first restored by [[Gandalf]]
column2: and later preceding their charge into the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]].

column1: Dire deeds awake: dark is it eastward.
Fell deeds awake: fire and slaughter!
The lines are written in imitation{{clarify}} of Germanic and Scandinavian
The second variant is probably{{clarify}} inspired by part of the Old Norse poem ''Völuspá''
column3: which describes the chaotic state of humankind in the End of Days just prior to Ragnarok
column4: the final battle of the Norse Gods.
